questions.question: What is aquaponics?
choices: A combination of aquaculture and hydroponics
A type of traditional Timorese farming
A method of raising fish in tanks
A system for growing plants in soil
questions.answer: A combination of aquaculture and hydroponics

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a component of an aquaponic system?
choices: Fish tank
Filtration system
Plant growing area
Soil bed
questions.answer: Soil bed

questions.question: What is the symbiotic relationship in aquaponic systems?
choices: Fish waste provides nutrients for plants, and plants clean water for fish
Fish eat the plants, and plants filter the water
Fish and plants compete for nutrients in the water
There is no symbiotic relationship in aquaponics
questions.answer: Fish waste provides nutrients for plants, and plants clean water for fish

questions.question: Which of the following fish species is suitable for aquaponics in Timor-Leste?
choices: Tilapia (Ikan mujair)
Salmon
Tuna
Goldfish
questions.answer: Tilapia (Ikan mujair)

questions.question: Which of these plant types is NOT mentioned as suitable for aquaponics in Timor-Leste?
choices: Root vegetables
Leafy greens
Herbs
Fruiting plants
questions.answer: Root vegetables

questions.question: How can aquaponics help with water conservation in Timor-Leste?
choices: By recycling water in a closed-loop system
By using more water than traditional farming
By relying on frequent rainfall
By not requiring any water at all
questions.answer: By recycling water in a closed-loop system

questions.question: Aquaponics can allow for year-round food production in Timor-Leste.
choices: True
False
questions.answer: True

questions.question: What is one benefit of aquaponics for urban and peri-urban agriculture in Timor-Leste?
choices: Efficient use of limited space
Reliance on high-quality soil
Reduced need for water conservation
Elimination of the need for fish feed
questions.answer: Efficient use of limited space

questions.question: In aquaponic system design, what does 'system sizing and ratios' refer to?
choices: The ratio of fish to plants in the system
The size of the fish compared to the plants
The ratio of water to fish in the tanks
The size of the grow beds compared to the fish tanks
questions.answer: The ratio of fish to plants in the system

questions.question: What is the purpose of aeration and circulation in an aquaponic system?
choices: To provide oxygen for fish and distribute nutrients to plants
To keep the water cool in Timor-Leste's climate
To prevent algae growth in the system
To make the system look more visually appealing
questions.answer: To provide oxygen for fish and distribute nutrients to plants

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT mentioned as a challenge for implementing aquaponics in Timor-Leste?
choices: Lack of suitable fish species
Initial setup costs and technical knowledge required
Consistent electricity supply for pumps
Balancing pH and nutrients in the system
questions.answer: Lack of suitable fish species

questions.question: Sourcing fish feed is a potential challenge for aquaponics in Timor-Leste.
choices: True
False
questions.answer: True

questions.question: Which of the following could be a local alternative for fish feed in Timor-Leste?
choices: Food scraps and agricultural by-products
Imported commercial fish feed
Synthetic chemical nutrients
Gravel and rocks
questions.answer: Food scraps and agricultural by-products

questions.question: What is one potential benefit of integrating aquaponics with traditional Timorese farming practices?
choices: Combining modern technology with local knowledge and resources
Completely replacing traditional farming methods
Eliminating the need for water conservation
Reducing the diversity of crops and fish species
questions.answer: Combining modern technology with local knowledge and resources

questions.question: Which of the following is an example of a leafy green suitable for aquaponics in Timor-Leste?
choices: Water spinach (Kanko)
Basil (Xampu)
Tomatoes (Tomate)
Carp (Ikan karpa)
questions.answer: Water spinach (Kanko)

questions.question: Tilapia, catfish, and carp are all suitable fish species for aquaponics in Timor-Leste.
choices: True
False
questions.answer: True

questions.question: What is one way aquaponics can contribute to food security in Timor-Leste?
choices: By diversifying diet and income sources
By reducing the amount of food produced
By increasing reliance on imported fish feed
By limiting the types of crops that can be grown
questions.answer: By diversifying diet and income sources

questions.question: Which of the following is a key principle of aquaponic system design?
choices: Balancing the ratio of fish to plants
Using as much water as possible
Keeping fish and plants separate
Avoiding the use of local materials
questions.answer: Balancing the ratio of fish to plants

questions.question: What is the role of the filtration system in an aquaponic setup?
choices: To remove solid waste and convert ammonia to nitrates
To add nutrients to the water for the plants
To provide oxygen for the fish
To control the water temperature
questions.answer: To remove solid waste and convert ammonia to nitrates

questions.question: Which of the following is a potential challenge for marketing aquaponic produce in Timor-Leste?
choices: Acceptance of produce grown using a new method
Lack of demand for fresh fish and vegetables
Oversupply of aquaponic produce in the market
Inability to grow a variety of crops in aquaponics
questions.answer: Acceptance of produce grown using a new method

questions.question: What is one way to control water temperature in aquaponic systems in Timor-Leste's climate?
choices: Shading and insulating the fish tanks and grow beds
Adding hot water to the system
Increasing the stocking density of fish
Using artificial lighting to heat the water
questions.answer: Shading and insulating the fish tanks and grow beds

questions.question: Consistent electricity supply for water and air pumps can be a challenge in Timor-Leste.
choices: True
False
questions.answer: True

questions.question: What is one potential solution for areas with inconsistent electricity in Timor-Leste?
choices: Using solar-powered pumps and backup batteries
Relying on manual water circulation
Increasing the size of the fish tanks
Growing only plants that don't require much water
questions.answer: Using solar-powered pumps and backup batteries

questions.question: Proper pH and nutrient balance are crucial for the health of both fish and plants in aquaponics.
choices: True
False
questions.answer: True

questions.question: What is one way to maintain proper pH in an aquaponic system?
choices: Regularly testing and adjusting pH levels
Adding more fish to the tanks
Increasing the water temperature
Reducing the number of plants in the grow beds
questions.answer: Regularly testing and adjusting pH levels

questions.question: Which of the following is an example of a fruiting plant suitable for aquaponics in Timor-Leste?
choices: Tomatoes (Tomate)
Mint (Hortel√£)
Catfish (Ikan lele)
Water spinach (Kanko)
questions.answer: Tomatoes (Tomate)

questions.question: What is one benefit of using locally available materials in aquaponic system construction in Timor-Leste?
choices: Reducing costs and increasing sustainability
Improving the efficiency of the system
Increasing the variety of fish and crops that can be grown
Eliminating the need for water quality management
questions.answer: Reducing costs and increasing sustainability

questions.question: Aquaponics can help reduce reliance on soil quality in Timor-Leste.
choices: True
False
questions.answer: True

questions.question: What is one way aquaponics can contribute to resilience in Timor-Leste's food system?
choices: By providing a locally controlled source of fresh fish and vegetables
By increasing dependence on imported inputs
By reducing the diversity of crops and fish species grown
By requiring large amounts of land and water resources
questions.answer: By providing a locally controlled source of fresh fish and vegetables

questions.question: Which of the following is a key factor in the success of an aquaponic system?
choices: Proper management and maintenance of the system
Using the most expensive equipment and inputs
Having a large-scale commercial operation
Focusing on only one type of fish or crop
questions.answer: Proper management and maintenance of the system
